com.sri.ai.util.collect

Class EZIterator<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sri.ai.util.collect.EZIterator<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Iterator<E>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractFunctionalSequence, AdderIterator, AssignmentsSamplingIterator, CacheMapTest.EvenIntegerIterator, CartesianProductInMapIterator, CartesianProductIterator, CharactersAsStringsIterator, DepthFirstIterator, FirstNIterator, GeometricSeriesIterator, IntegerArithmeticSeriesIterator, IntegerGeometricSeriesIterator, IntegerIterator, MultinomialIterator, NonDeterministicIterator, OrderedPairsOfIntegersIterator, PairOfElementsInListIterator, RefinerIterator, StringIterator

    @Beta
public abstract class EZIterator<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Iterator<E>
    An abstract class meant to make the implementation of iterators easier. One needs only to extend it and define calculateNext(), which must calculate the next object in the sequence, or null if it is over. EZIterator defines the Iterator interface based on this method (without supporting the remove() method. If the constructor already computes the next (thus, the first) element, the protected field onNext must be set to true. If the constructor determines there is no next element, it must set onNext to true and next to null.
    Author:
    braz

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EZIterator()
      A default constructor that assumes next needs to be computed.
      EZIterator(boolean onNext)
      A constructor indicating that the field next already contains the next value to be provided by next right at construction.
